summary:
The Society of Jesus, or Jesuits, is a Catholic religious order started in 1540 by Ignatius of Loyola. Jesuits work in 112 countries, focusing on education, research, and helping people. They take vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience and follow the pope's orders closely.

Known as "God's soldiers," Jesuits had a big role in the Counter-Reformation. They traveled the world as missionaries, spreading Christianity. Sometimes, they faced criticism and were even kicked out of some countries. The order was once disbanded but was later restarted.
title: Jesuits
